Ad Text:
Company Description


Lendi Group is a market-leading digital platform business focused on transforming the home loan industry. It operates the country’s #1 retail mortgage broker – the iconic Aussie Home Loans franchise – and the Australia’s #1 digital mortgage brand, Lendi.

Together, with its national network of 1,300 brokers and 230 retail stores, the Lendi Group brands give all Australians the power of choice, and confidence, in one of life’s biggest financial decisions.

Building on this market-leading foundation, Lendi Groups vision is to be the undisputed place for Australians to buy and own property through our new Aussie Homes propositions.

Lendi Group’s loan book is more than $100b and it was named Australia’s Aggregator of the Year for 2024

Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion are fundamental to the success of Lendi Group. We’re passionate about fostering an environment where our team members feel valued and supported and we celebrate everyone’s unique identity.

To learn more about life at Lendi Group check out our blog: https://www.lendi.com.au/inspire/category/life-at-lendi/

About the role?

Lendi Group is looking for a Senior Platform Engineer to join our Platform team. A small, tight and highly collaborative team working in a rapid and evolving DevSecOps environment. We like to have fun and we work hard at looking after each other. 

The Platform team builds cross-team tooling and services that empower our Specialist and Product teams to deliver customer value efficiently and with high quality. The engineering department is going through significant growth and there are opportunities for you to help shape the culture and technology moving forward.

Please note, this is a 12 month Fixed term opportunity.

Job Description


Manage a high performing & secure cloud environment
Owning major parts of the system, designing and delivering quality stable solutions 
Developing clean, maintainable code that is suitable for continuous integration and deployment, following best practices and DevOps/Software guidelines
Collaborating as part of a cross-functional agile team
Improve our platform by learning and implementing new technologies
Build & manage different tools to facilitate the way different teams use our platform
Automate whenever possible so it is easy to deploy to multiple environments & recover
Increase the visibility of the different services
Work with different teams to understand how to better use our platform
Experiment and build with AI and integrate it into our tooling and environments.
Participate on a fun team that loves learning together & helping each other
Owning the code you and your team build, which means supporting debugging, monitoring and alerting in the production

Qualifications


3-5+ years of experience as a Platform and/or DevOps Engineer
A passion for learning every day 
A desire to work with technologies such as Kubernetes, AWS, Large Language Models (LLMs) and others
Experience working with configuration as code, CI/CD and pushing and reviewing code.

Additional Information


Lendi Group teams operate across Australia and the Philippines. We’re committed to creating a new era of seamless connection in property finance by changing the way Australians experience property lending, for good.

A few of the benefits that our people rave about include:

A vibrant, relaxed, yet professional culture
Holistic wellbeing programs offering 24/7 support, including medical, mental health, and financial wellbeing services to enable our workforce to thrive at home and work
Generous Paid Parental Leave: we celebrate our growing Lendi Group family with 18-26 weeks leave for primary carers and up to 4 weeks for secondary carers
An additional week’s Loyalty Leave each year after reaching 3 years of service
Wellness initiatives with a strong focus on psychological safety
Social groups such as our industry-leading Women in Technology group.

Our culture is guided by our 3 core values: We Are Stronger United; Act Like You Own It; and Keep Home Loans Human. Our values are part of our core DNA that helps Lendi Group to attract, engage and evolve the right talent and build best-in-class products.

Feeling like you don’t meet all the skills listed? That’s ok; we are always on the lookout for different skills, experience, and qualities and so we’d still like to hear from you.

#lendigroup #LI-GR2 #LI-hybrid

Snowflake is about empowering enterprises to achieve their full potential — and people too. With a culture that’s all in on impact, innovation, and collaboration, Snowflake is the sweet spot for building big, moving fast, and taking technology — and careers — to the next level.

We are looking for a Principal Solution Engineer who will serve as a dedicated trusted advisor and proactive strategic technology partner for Major accounts. In this role you will work directly with C-level executives, data leaders, and engineering teams to influence the data, AI and technology roadmap while driving expanded consumption and adoption of Snowflake's AI Data Cloud platform. You will also serve as the technical customer advocate internally at Snowflake, working closely with our product managers and technical executive sponsors to ensure customer needs drive product innovation.

As a Snowflake Principal Solution Engineer you must excel at translating complex technical concepts into compelling business value propositions that resonate with executive stakeholders. You thrive in strategic account environments, have exceptional C-level communication skills, and possess the gravitas to influence technology roadmaps at the highest organizational levels. You are equally comfortable presenting to boards and CEOs as you are collaborating with engineering teams and advocating for customer requirements with our internal product organization.


In this role you will get to:


Present Snowflake's AI Data Cloud technology and strategic vision to C-level executives, translating complex technical capabilities into clear business value propositions that drive strategic decision-making

Work hands-on with our customer’s technical teams to architect sophisticated data and AI solutions while communicating business impact and ROI to executive leadership through quarterly business reviews and strategic planning sessions

Serve as the customer’s primary technical advocate within Snowflake, partnering closely with our product managers and technical executive sponsors to ensure their strategic needs influence our product roadmap and feature development priorities

Immerse yourself in the customer’s business model, competitive landscape, and strategic priorities to proactively identify opportunities where Snowflake's platform can accelerate their innovation and market leadership

Lead executive briefings, strategic architecture sessions, and board presentations that align technical roadmaps with business strategy and competitive positioning

Collaborate with Snowflake's Product Management, Engineering, and executive leadership to continuously improve our products based on strategic customer feedback and requirements

On day one we will expect you to have:


10+ years of industry experience with significant C-level executive exposure and proven track record managing large enterprise accounts

Experience working with modern data technology (e.g. dbt, spark, containers, devops tooling, orchestration tools, git, etc.)

Deep expertise in cloud data platforms, AI/ML technologies (including LLMs, machine learning pipelines, and MLOps), data warehousing, and modern data architecture

Hands-on expertise with SQL, Python, and data modeling concepts, with ability to explain complex technical architectures in business terms

Exceptional presentation and communication skills specifically with C-level executives, including demonstrated ability to translate highly complex technical concepts into compelling business value propositions that drive executive decision-making

Proven experience working with product management teams to influence roadmaps, prioritize features, and drive customer-centric development through effective internal advocacy

Outstanding ability to conduct executive briefings, board presentations, and strategic planning sessions with senior leadership teams across technical and business functions

Strong track record of internal advocacy within technology companies, representing customer needs to product and engineering organizations while facilitating cross-functional collaboration

Experience in SaaS, consumer technology, or design/creative industries preferred, with understanding of business intelligence, analytics, and data-driven decision making

University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred. Masters in Data Science or Business Administration is a plus

Experience facilitating C-level strategic planning sessions focused on data and AI strategy would be beneficial but not required

About Our Team:


Our Principal Solution Engineers are customer obsessed and serve as the bridge between our most strategic customers and our internal product organization. We believe in the transformative power of executive relationships and technical advocacy. We love to learn, are open to giving and receiving feedback, and are passionate about making our clients successful while ensuring their voice shapes Snowflake's future. Our team works to ensure data is accessible, usable and valuable to everyone while driving product innovation through customer advocacy.


About Snowflake


Snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, Snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions.

Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

For jobs located in the United States, please visit the job posting on the Snowflake Careers Site for salary and benefits information: careers.snowflake.com
